text: oh gosh hi everyone anthony fantano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time
for a review of this new weather station
album
ignorance this is the latest full-length
lp from toronto indie outfit the weather
station
who's been at it for well over a decade
at this point pounding the pavement
through the 2010s with their
elegant and rustic shades of folk and
singer songwriter music
solid band but never quite blew me away
however
ignorance does present a change of pace
a lot of the band's core fans are
excited about
and they are certainly turning up the
heat on this one with more lush
instrumentals groovier rhythm sections
the production is a kaleidoscopic
display
of pianos bass guitars drums strings
woodwinds futuristic synths those synths
especially on the song loss which plods
along in a very linear fashion
almost like it's a kraut rock track the
record overall is pretty dense
instrumentally but everything
is placed and orchestrated in a very
methodical manner
which in a way does remind me of former
art poppers wild beasts but
maybe not quite as eccentric this record
also sees parallels with classics in the
sophisti pop genre such as destroyers
kaput but
obviously not as fun or campy just to
get a frame of reference i suppose the
vibe on this lp is more along the lines
of what haym has done in this field
already
for example the track separated is a
song i could see the trio singing but
the weather station's approach to song
structure on this record is a lot more
indirect
less emphasis on hooks in order to focus
more on the overall progression
of the track as a result the band may
undersell
a chorus on the first leg of the song in
order to bring the entire thing to a
place
where you're hitting a lush instrumental
crescendo in the second half
which is typically a formula i
personally am drawn to but i still ended
up
walking away from this record feeling a
bit torn i really do think the
production on this lp generally speaking
is well done
and exquisite sure maybe the
instrumental palettes here
aren't exactly adventurous but they are
well balanced and diverse
the record is just consistently ornate
and refined it's clear a lot of effort
went into it on the instrumental front
that being said though i can really
take or leave many of the songs on this
lp and on top of that
the vocals are usually not much to write
home about either
nowhere is that more apparent than on
tracks like atlantic
where front woman tomorrow lindemann's
hushed lead vocals
are almost completely buried under these
bold rushes of pianos
or the track trust where the more bare
and somber
instrumentation really could have used a
vocal that commanded took the lead
shown bright but even in this low-key
moment tomorrow's very dodgy
and whispery lead vocals just don't do
anything with the extravagant stage they
have been placed on
there are tracks on this thing with
undeniably solid beats hooks and tunes
but the band just doesn't go the extra
mile to
sell it whether that be with the song
heart or tried to tell you which
sounds kind of like a cut from the last
two killers records but
on one too many benadryl yeah generally
the tracks on this thing
don't really stir up any kind of emotion
in me outside of just
vaguely sounding bittersweet rarely are
the lyrics on this project
stunning too one of the few moments that
stood out to me on that front was the
opener robber there are some personal
opinions of
robbery that tamara voices on this track
that i don't
necessarily agree with but you know what
she's putting out there is at least
interesting to chew over there is
something also to be said for the
dramatic presentation
of the vocals on this track which sadly
doesn't really carry over into the rest
of the record
you know it's tough i found this record
to have some good foundational elements
to it the production
as well as the instrumental performances
were enjoyable and solid
pleasant surely but gosh were the vocals
the songwriting and just the overall
presentation of this thing very low
impact for sure the record is agreeable
and there's nothing awful about it on
its surface
but i feel like that's only the case by
virtue of playing it as
safe as possible sure this sound is new
for the weather station but in the
grander scheme of things is it doing
anything exciting
not really as a result of that i'm
walking away pretty indifferent
on this one feeling a strong four to a
light five
here tran position have you given this
album a listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best you're the best what should i
review next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head it's another
video that you can check out hit that up
or the link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano music reviews
but forever
